title: 'Story of the game': Defense keys Ohio State win
content: No. 3 Ohio State, behind a stifling defense, opened its season with a 14-7 victory over top-ranked Texas on Saturday.

title: Manning struggles vs. lofty expectations in debut
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning struggled in his starting debut, completing 17 of 30 passes for 170 yards with 1 TD and 1 interception in the loss.

title: Ostapenko apologizes for words toward Townsend
content: Jelena Ostapenko apologized on social media Saturday, three days after telling Taylor Townsend that she had "no class" and "no education" following their second-round match at the US Open.

title: Ducks mascot trips, loses head in costume mishap
content: Oregon's mascot had an embarrassing moment Saturday when he ran out on the field at Autzen Stadium and tripped, causing the head of his costume to fly off.

title: Retzlaff stars for Tulane after 'long offseason'
content: Jake Retzlaff, who won 11 games at BYU last season but transferred after learning he faced a suspension for violating the school's honor code, passed for a touchdown in his Tulane debut and scored on a 69-yard run as the Green Wave topped Northwestern.

title: Sources: Thielen took $2M pay cut to rejoin Vikes
content: Former Panthers wide receiver Adam Thielen took a $2 million pay cut to help finalize a trade back to his hometown Vikings, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Venus' doubles run at US Open reaches 3rd round
content: Venus Williams and Leylah Fernandez reached the third round of women's doubles at the US Open by defeating Ulrikke Eikeri and Eri Hozumi 7-6 (1), 6-1 on Saturday.

title: Jordan, champion with Alabama, Cowboys, dies
content: Lee Roy Jordan, who won a national title at Alabama and a Super Bowl title with the Cowboys, has died at the age of 84.

title: üèà Adam Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: Lee Corso's farewell to 'GameDay': Behind the scenes of a football celebrationÔªø
content: Fans, many without tickets to the game, came from all over the country to Columbus to get a glimpse of Corso one last time.

title: Georgia Tech's national title jab, Tennessee's 'orange crush,' and more Week 1 CFB trolls
content: Georgia Tech and Colorado split the 1990 national title, but neither school is pleased with that arrangement -- which the Yellow Jackets referenced after their win.

title: Any win will do for Amorim on this Man United roller coaster of emotions
content: Manchester United's victory over Burnley was far from convincing, but after their nightmare in Grimsby, Ruben Amorim will take anything he can get.

title: VAR controversy masks Chelsea's issues in win over Fulham
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca will have to concede that his side was lucky to beat Fulham on Saturday.

title: Coco Gauff vs. Naomi Osaka: Who will win?
content: Naomi Osaka and Coco Gauff will meet in the fourth round on Monday night. And it's more of a toss-up than recent results suggest.

title: Four questions in the Micah Parsons trade aftermath: Why in the world would Dallas do this?
content: What are the Cowboys doing? Did they get enough in return? And does Parsons put the Packers at the top of the NFC? Let's sort through this wild trade.

title: A new look in Green Bay: Parsons trade continues Packers' aggressive offseason
content: Signs of change in Green Bay include paying up to trade for Parsons after finally taking a WR in the first round.

title: Chasing history: Can Derrick Henry run past seven Hall of Famers to reach top 10 all time?
content: The Baltimore Ravens running back sits at No. 19 on the rushing list and has a chance to bypass seven Hall of Famers.

title: College football betting: Go with the experienced Irish or wild-card Canes?
content: The Fighting Irish head to Miami as small favorites after making it to the national championship game last season. Here's how to bet the game.

title: Betting NFL milestones: Mike Evans and Derrick Henry chasing down history
content: Potential career milestones are on the horizon for several players. We predict if they get there in 2025.

title: Guide to the NFL's rookie class: Who is flying under the radar? Who will win OROY, DROY?
content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners, fantasy favorites and QB updates.

title: Let's predict the draft: Kiper's 10 preseason takes, including why all eyes are on Penn State
content: How many quarterbacks will go in Round 1? Mel Kiper Jr. makes predictions for the 2026 NFL draft class.

title: Toto Wolff admits he misses 'great enemy' Christian Horner in F1
content: Mercedes boss Toto Wolff has admitted he misses having his "great enemy" Christian Horner in the Formula 1 paddock after Horner was sacked by Red Bull after 20 years in charge of the team.

title: From Collier to Clark and more: How injury returns could impact the playoffs
content: Napheesa Collier and Breanna Stewart are back, with more injured stars eyeing returns before the postseason.

title: Debunking your favorite NFL officiating conspiracy theories
content: Are the refs penalizing some teams more than others? Which coaches win challenges? We crunched the numbers.

title: NBA predictions: 10 teams that could exceed, fall short of ESPN's forecast
content: Too low on OKC? Too high on the Spurs? Tim Bontemps breaks down ESPN's Summer Forecast win predictions.

title: Liz Loza's draft rules (there are none!), five players to pick and two to fade
content: It's finally time to make picks, so consider the trends surrounding these players as you prepare your draft board.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning of the fun. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a savvy, championship-winning manager.

title: Baylor's anthracite and chrome combo headline best college football uniforms from Week 1
content: While Baylor revives its gold chrome helmets, Utah State will be donning cow print helmets that have a hilarious origin story.

title: Ben Shelton and Trinity Rodman relationship timeline
content: The NWSL player playfully challenged the tennis star with a question about his 2nd-round US Open performance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea could make late move for Barcelona star L√≥pez
content: Chelsea could make a fresh offer for Barcelona star Ferm√≠n L√≥pez. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Travel dip: Fewer Indians flying to US in June; first decline since 2001
content: For the first time this millennium, excluding the Covid period, Indian visits to the US declined in June 2025, dropping 8% to 2.1 lakh. This fall aligns with an overall decrease in international visitors to the US. While industry experts hesitate to attribute the decline solely to stricter visa policies, concerns are rising, particularly regarding student visas.

title: 'India shouldn't be unfairly targeted': Jaishankar amid US pressure over Russia oil
content: "Had a telecon today with Finnish Foreign Minister," Jaishankar posted on X. "Our discussions centered around the Ukraine conflict and its ramifications. India should not be unfairly targeted in that context. We have always advocated dialogue and diplomacy."

title: Modi meets Xi today amid global trade disruptions
content: Narendra Modi's visit to China marks a significant step towards normalizing relations after a period of tension. Discussions with President Xi Jinping are expected to focus on strengthening trade ties, addressing border issues, and fostering a long-term strategic partnership. Modi will also meet with Myanmar's leader, emphasizing the need for democratic restoration amidst ongoing ethnic violence and cross-border terrorism.

title: Cloudbursts rip through Jammu‚Äôs mountains, 11 dead as Aug rain toll climbs to 122
content: Torrential rain and cloudbursts in Jammu and Kashmir have caused devastating flash floods and landslides, resulting in 11 deaths in Ramban and Reasi districts. A couple and their five children were among those buried alive. The Jammu-Srinagar national highway partially reopened after being suspended for five days.

title: Dharmasthala probe: Mask-man Chinnaiah visited Bengaluru with skull for planning
content: The SIT is investigating the Dharmasthala mass burial case, bringing 'mask-man' Chinnaiah to Bengaluru to inspect key locations. One such location is T Jayanth's residence in Mallasandra, where Chinnaiah allegedly acquired a skull. Jayanth confirmed Chinnaiah's visit and their trip to Delhi to present the case, asserting his innocence and willingness to cooperate with the investigation.

title: US embassy to visa applicants in India: This passport service has been discontinued
content: Starting August 1, 2025, the US will discontinue third-party passport collection services for visa applicants. Individuals can collect their passports in person or opt for home delivery at a fee of Rs 1,200. For applicants under 18, a parent or guardian must collect the passport with an original consent letter from both parents and required identification.

title: 'Purchased Rs 450 knife online': Jilted lover kills Class 10 girl; stalked her for days
content: A 17-year-old in Nagpur meticulously planned the murder of a 16-year-old girl, purchasing a knife online. Despite being a minor, police are seeking to try him as an adult due to the premeditation involved. The victim's family had previously reported threats from the accused, but a police compromise attempt failed, ultimately emboldening him.

title: Tejashwi declares himself INDIA bloc‚Äôs Bihar CM face
content: Tejashwi Yadav declared himself the CM face of the INDIA bloc in Ara during the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra,' criticizing the Nitish Kumar government for allegedly copying his ideas. Rahul Gandhi acknowledged the yatra's growing national impact, while Akhilesh Yadav expressed confidence in stopping the BJP in Bihar, urging voters to defeat the ruling regime.

title: Leaking customer data & more: How bankers helped cyber gangs; 42 arrested
content: Gurgaon police have uncovered a disturbing trend of bank employees colluding with cybercriminals, leading to significant financial fraud. Arrests of 42 bank staffers revealed their involvement in leaking customer data, facilitating suspicious transactions, and tipping off fraudsters about police investigations.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet on surviving cancer twice: ‚ÄòYou need to‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet, a prominent figure in the business world, has faced two battles with cancer. These experiences profoundly shaped her perspective on both her professional and personal life. Sweet emphasizes the importance of prioritizing health, advocating for regular self-exams and mammograms, and striving for a long and fulfilling life.

title: No permanent friends or foes in international ties: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh emphasized India's commitment to its interests and self-reliance amid global tensions, highlighting that nations have permanent interests, not permanent allies. Speaking at the NDTV Defence Summit, Singh alluded to US tariffs while PM Modi attended the SCO summit in China.

title: LoC shootout ends decades-long run of ‚Äòhuman GPS‚Äô terrorist
content: Security forces in north Kashmir neutralized Bagu Khan, a seasoned terrorist guide known as "human GPS," who facilitated nearly 100 infiltration attempts across the LoC over decades. His death is a significant blow to infiltration networks, limiting the ability of Pakistan-backed groups to navigate treacherous terrain.

title: HC suspends Satlok Ashram preacher Rampal‚Äôs sentence after 10 years in jail
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has suspended the sentence of Rampal, the controversial preacher of Satlok Ashram Barwala, who was convicted of murder and has been imprisoned for over a decade. The court cited debatable medical evidence, his age, and the lack of support from the deceased's family as reasons for the suspension, pending his appeal.

title: Tesla bull on Nvidia CEO: Jensen is 10% politician; shares take on company stock
content: Tesla investor Dan Ives praises Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang. Ives addresses geopolitical risks between the US and China. Nvidia aims to sell Blackwell chips in China. The company is willing to meet US government terms. Ives is optimistic about Nvidia's future. He predicts Nvidia's market value could reach $5 trillion by early 2026. He now favors Nvidia over Palantir stock.

title: Bills for removal of PM, mantris: Birla hopes oppn will reconsider JPC boycott
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla is trying to persuade opposition parties to join the joint parliamentary committee (JPC) reviewing bills concerning the removal of ministers detained on criminal charges. Despite the INDIA bloc's boycott, Birla hopes for reconsideration and emphasizes the importance of debate over disruptions in Parliament.

title: ‚ÄòFirst-day nerves‚Äô: Hailee Steinfeld recalls set jitters; blockbuster streak continues
content: BAFTA-nominated actress Hailee Steinfeld, known for roles in 'True Grit' and 'Sinners', recently shared her feelings about starting new projects, admitting to experiencing first-day nerves despite her extensive experience. Steinfeld, who values privacy, maintained a low profile with Buffalo Bills' star Josh Allen until their engagement in November 2024.

title: From 'I love you' to trade talk: What Jerry Jones said about Micah Parsons
content: Dallas Cowboys traded Micah Parsons to Green Bay Packers. This move frees up 19 million dollars. Cowboys now have 42 million dollars in cap space for 2025. This allows them to sign other players. They can extend contracts of DaRon Bland and Tyler Smith. Jerry Jones mentioned Parsons could bring resources in a trade.

title: Patrick & Brittany Mahomes: Motherhood‚Äôs emotional toll on NFL star‚Äôs wife
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes and mother of three, recently shared her experiences with the challenges of motherhood. She highlighted the difficulty of balancing personal time with childcare responsibilities and confessed to struggling with mom guilt when accepting help or leaving her children. Despite these struggles, she remains a dedicated supporter of her husband's NFL career.

title: How to Get an S-Class Corvette Ship in No Man‚Äôs Sky Voyager with Advanced Corvette Parts
content: The No Man's Sky Voyager update introduces S-class Corvette ships. These ships are customizable and expandable. Players can acquire these ships by gathering resources. Salvaging scrap on planets is one way. Exploring derelict freighters is another. Trading modules at workshops also helps. Upgrading interiors and balancing builds are important. These Corvettes serve as mobile bases.

title: Tariff war: Piyush Goyal says India Inc in ‚Äòcomfort zone‚Äô, urges global push
content: Piyush Goyal urged Indian businesses to explore global opportunities, noting the domestic market's comfort zone. He dismissed negative narratives, highlighting the 7.8% GDP growth and resilience against US tariffs. Goyal encouraged value addition and government support, while the UAE affirmed strong India partnership amidst global trade shifts.

title: Hindu marriage valid even if not registered: Allahabad HC clarifies; family court order set aside
content: The Allahabad High Court has ruled that a Hindu marriage's validity isn't contingent on registration, clarifying that family courts can't demand a marriage certificate for mutual consent divorce petitions. The court emphasized that a registration certificate serves merely as evidence of marriage.

title: 11 years strong: Union, Wade celebrate with throwback posts; Instagram montage stuns fans
content: Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade celebrated their 11th wedding anniversary, sharing a heartwarming video montage on Instagram showcasing their journey. Union expressed gratitude for their enduring love and the support they've received. She also revealed that Wade's family initially had reservations about their relationship due to their age gap, particularly his sister Tragil, but she eventually earned their trust.

title: How an IAS officer‚Äôs efforts transformed a village once branded as ‚Äòcriminal‚Äô
content: In 1973, IAS officer Yogendra Narain's posting to Muzaffarnagar as district magistrate led him to assist the Banwariya community, who faced police harassment due to historical stigma. Narain's intervention included establishing a school, promoting education and employment, and ending police harassment. Over five decades, his efforts resulted in around 130 villagers securing government jobs, transforming the community's prospects.

title: Trump to skip India visit? US President may not attend 2025 Quad meet - Report
content: US President Donald Trump's planned visit to India for the Quad Summit is off, signaling a deterioration in his relationship with Narendra Modi. The souring ties stem from Trump's repeated, and disputed, claims of resolving the India-Pakistan conflict, coupled with Modi's refusal to endorse Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: 'Don‚Äôt talk nonsense': Tej Pratap slams 'abki baar Tejashwi sarkar' chant; calls out 'ego'
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, recently ousted from his family and party, criticized egoism in leadership during a Jehanabad gathering, distancing himself from chants of "Abki Baar Tejashwi Sarkar." He emphasized that government formation relies on the people, not individuals, cautioning against arrogance. Lalu Prasad Yadav expelled Tej Pratap for six years due to disregard for moral values and irresponsible behavior.

title: 'Less than 50 weapons': IAF on Op Sindoor; reveals why Pak asked for ceasefire
content: Following the Pahalgam terror massacre, the Indian Army retaliated heavily against Pakistan's ceasefire violations, firing thousands of artillery shells and small arms rounds across the Line of Control. The IAF conducted precision strikes on terror hubs and military infrastructure within Pakistan, compelling them to seek a ceasefire after significant damage.

title: Birthday goals: Brittany Mahomes turns 30; Swift joins Nashville dinner
content: Brittany Mahomes celebrated her 30th birthday in style. The celebration included a private jet party. Pop queen Taylor Swift joined the bash in Nashville. Swift and Mahomes have grown closer since Swift started dating Travis Kelce. The duo are often seen at NFL games. The Kelce-Mahomes-Swift circle is becoming talked about. The friendship is more than a game-day bond.

title: Belgian court denies bail to Mehul Choksi; extradition set for Sept
content: A Belgian court has denied bail to fugitive diamantaire Mehul Choksi, wanted in India for bank fraud exceeding Rs 13,900 crore, ahead of his extradition hearing. Indian authorities presented evidence of his past escapes and involvement in economic offenses, leading the court to deem him a flight risk.

title: 'I want my Porsche': Yuvraj Singh‚Äôs six-sixes bat now with Lalit Modi ‚Äì here‚Äôs why
content: Lalit Modi, the IPL's founder, pledged a Porsche to any Indian cricketer hitting six sixes or taking six wickets in an over during the 2007 T20 World Cup. Yuvraj Singh famously achieved this feat against Stuart Broad, prompting Modi to fulfill his promise. Yuvraj received his Porsche, and Modi acquired the iconic bat, a cherished memento of that historic moment.

title: UK: Keir Starmer replaces top aide; third change in less than a year
content: Keir Starmer is replacing his principal private secretary, Ninjeri Pandit, amid a significant government reboot following a challenging first year marked by plummeting approval ratings and a surge in illegal migrant crossings. This shake-up includes Pandit's move to a new policy delivery role, as Starmer seeks more direct oversight.

title: India‚Äôs urban families face 9x higher school expenses than rural households
content: A recent survey reveals a significant disparity in education costs across India. Urban families spend considerably more on private schooling than rural families on government education. Tuition fees and coaching classes contribute to this divide. Families bear most of the financial burden. This highlights inequities in the education system.

title: 'False & baseless': PIB busts Pakistan claim of India's S-400 hit; clarifies image origin
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has refuted Pakistan's propaganda claiming India's S-400 air defence system was damaged during Operation Sindoor. PIB clarified that reports of destruction are false, and the circulated image is from a 2010 Russian parade. India launched Operation Sindoor after the Pahalgam terror attack, striking terror hubs, and intercepted Pakistani drones and missiles using the S-400.

title: 50 gold medals! India create history in Asian Shooting Championship
content: India made history at the 16th Asian Shooting Championship in Shymkent, Kazakhstan, securing a leading 50 gold medals. The senior team excelled in Olympic events, earning six gold, two silver, and three bronze medals, only behind China. Junior shooters also shone, contributing significantly to India's total of 99 medals, surpassing Kazakhstan and China in the overall standings.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo vs Cyprus: Greece makes bold call ‚Äî EuroBasket 2025 showdown looms
content: Greece faced Cyprus in EuroBasket 2025 without Giannis Antetokounmpo, despite his strong performance against Italy. Coach Vassilis Spanoulis opted to rest the star player, prioritizing his fitness for future crucial matches, particularly against Georgia. This decision allows other players like Kostas Sloukas and Tyler Dorsey to step up, balancing the team's strategy for the tournament.

title: Dhankhar applies for pension; seeks MLA benefits - why was it stopped in 2019
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar, after resigning as Vice President citing health issues, has applied to resume his pension as a former legislator in Rajasthan. He previously received this pension until becoming the governor of West Bengal in 2019. Now 74, Dhankhar is entitled to a monthly pension of Rs 42,000, with the Rajasthan Assembly secretariat processing his application following his resignation.

title: 'Photo-op, Truth posts': Why PM Modi avoided Trump‚Äôs calls, Washington invite
content: The last officially acknowledged phone call between PM Modi and Trump took place on June 17, when Trump left the G7 Summit in Canada abruptly and flew back to Washington. A bilateral meeting between the two leaders, planned on the sidelines of the summit, had to be cancelled. During that call, Trump invited PM Modi to stop over in Washington.

title: Trump tariff: Ministry drafts multi-tier plan to shield Indian exporters
content: The Commerce Ministry of India is developing a strategy. This strategy aims to support Indian exporters facing new US tariffs. The plan includes easing liquidity and offering flexibility to SEZ units. It also promotes import substitution. E-commerce export hubs will be operationalised. The government will focus on financial and non-financial support.

title: Israeli airstrike kills Houthi rebel PM Ahmed al-Rahawi in Sanaa
content: Israeli airstrikes in Sanaa, Yemen, resulted in the death of Ahmed al-Rahawi, the Houthi prime minister, along with several ministers during a government workshop. The Israeli military confirmed targeting a Houthi site, amidst ongoing Houthi attacks on Israel and Red Sea shipping in support of Palestinians. Earlier strikes this week in Sanaa caused numerous casualties, escalating tensions in the region.

title: Watch: Pilot rescued in 30 seconds after dramatic plane crash off Oak Island
content: A pilot, Mark Finkelstein, miraculously survived a plane crash off Oak Island, North Carolina, after his engine failed mid-air. He was rescued within 30 seconds by the Oak Island Water Rescue team after the plane flipped upside down upon impact.

title: PM Modi in China: Meet with Xi, Putin lined up amid Trump tariff strain - list of SCO attendees
content: Tianjin is preparing to host the SCO Summit, with President Xi Jinping welcoming leaders including PM Modi and President Putin. Against a backdrop of global tensions heightened by US tariffs, the summit aims to project China as a stabilizing force and foster unity among the Global South. Discussions will likely encompass counterterrorism, trade, and a multipolar world order.

title: Makhachev‚Äôs coach: From Syko Stu‚Äôs provocation to Rampage Jackson‚Äôs son clash
content: Javier Mendez, Islam Makhachev's coach, addressed the Raja Jackson-Syko Stu Smith incident, suggesting provocation from Smith and instigation from other wrestlers. Mendez argued that KnokX Pro Wrestling organizers were also at fault for placing an untrained MMA fighter, Raja Jackson, in an unscripted wrestling match without proper guidance. The incident, involving serious injuries to Smith, is currently under police investigation.

title: Microbes that digest plastic may also fuel antibiotic resistance
content: An IISER Kolkata has raised the troubling possibility that those microbes capable of breaking down plastics are also reservoirs of antibiotic resistance genes; plastic particles may serve as hotbeds where the genes accumulate and spread between microbes

title: Government set to reclaim Abhimaan Studio land over condition violations
content: The land in question originally was part of the Turahalli State Forest, as the erstwhile Mysore government had declared 62 acres and 20 guntas in Survey No. 26 of Mylasandra village as reserve forest in 1935, Karnataka Forest Minister said

title: Nagaland TV journalist shot in Manipur
content: Dip Saikia, a reporter with Hornbill TV, was covering a flower festival in a village in the Senapati district; villagers caught the shooter, a youth

title: Govt. to launch Adivasi languages translation app
content: The application will have the capability to translate Bhili, Mundari, Gondi, Santali, Kui, and Garo to and from English and Hindi

title: Fewer than 50 weapons forced Pakistan to call for ceasefire: Air Marshal Tiwari
content: The senior IAF officer said some of the Pakistan targets that were ‚Äútaken out‚Äù in the course of the mission were not hit even during the 1971 war

title: How did Kerala pull off¬†digital literacy feat?
content: Who were the volunteers? Who were trained? What do the numbers tell? Which panchayat was declared the State‚Äôs first fully digitally literate panchayat? What is the plan going forward? Why is the State focusing on smartphones instead of computer literacy?

title: B. Sudershan Reddy | Justice for all
content: The joint Opposition candidate for the Vice-Presidential election comes with a career-long record of holding power to account

title: Action against alleged traffic rule violations during Onam revelry
content: Licence of the driver who reportedly drove a rented KSRTC bus recklessly during the celebrations suspended

title: Ernakulam KSRTC bus stand set to receive long overdue facelift
content: State commits ‚Çπ12 crore for the construction of new integrated terminal on KSRTC land at Karikkamuri; KHRI to be roped in to prepare design based on which PWD will revise estimate

title: Deadline for evacuation of Chander Kunj apartment owners goes unmet
content: Residents refuse to vacate as the Army Welfare Housing Organisation has failed to pay advance rent to apartment owners for alternative accommodation during the demolition and reconstruction period, as agreed

title: Cusat to join hands with LG Soft India to set up innovative research lab
content: The joint initiative aims to address the critical challenges facing the rapidly expanding smart home segment

title: Keltron set to enter Zimbabwe
content: Zimbabwe‚Äôs Deputy Minister of Industry and Commerce Rajesh Kumar Indukant Modi handed over the purchase order to State Industries Minister P. Rajeeve

title: WBSSC publishes lists of tainted candidates barred from fresh recruitment in schools
content: The publication of these lists comes after a Supreme Court bench of Justice Sanjay Kumar and Justice Satish Chandra Sharma came down heavily on the WBSSC and directed that ‚Äòtainted and ineligible‚Äô candidates will not be able to appear for the recruitment process being carried by the Commission.

title: Sports Minister withdraws from PPP model stadium on CU campus
content: This follows objections raised by Vice-Chancellor and Syndicate members during a meeting on the project attended by V. Abdurahiman at the university

title: Make urea available for Odisha farmers, demands former CM Naveen Patnaik
content: Delay in the Talcher fertiliser plant, whose foundation stone was laid in 2018, is also a concern, said Mr. Patnaik in a letter to J.P. Nadda, Union Minister of Chemicals and Fertilisers

title: Odisha, Chhattisgarh make headway towards resolving Mahanadi River water dispute
content: A high level meeting between two States resolved that technical committees headed by the Engineers-in-chief of both States will meet weekly in September to identify and resolve critical issues

title: Centre overruled industry demands on safeguards for phone, internet tapping: RTI response
content: DoT ignored demands for independent oversight, jurisdictional clarity, compensation for interception costs; it incorporated the demand for secure communications between telcos and the  government

title: Assam‚Äôs Bodoland brings ISRO-backed space studies to classrooms
content: The Bodoland Space Education Programme was framed to motivate school students in remote areas to aim for the moon and beyond

title: PM Modi likely to visit Manipur in second week of September, first since ethnic violence erupted in 2023
content: The Prime Minister is likely to visit Imphal and Churachandpur districts in the Northeastern State where he is expected to meet people displaced from their homes due to the ethnic strife

title: Many Memoranda of Understanding signed by DMK government remain only on paper: Nainar Nagenthran
content: It has not released a white paper on how much investment has been attracted through such trips undertaken since the DMK came to power in 2021, he says

title: Supreme Court Bar Association flags low representation of women in higher judiciary
content: The resolution notes no woman judge elevated in latest Supreme Court appointments; several High Courts have none

title: One stitch at a time: Saga of garment workers in Bengaluru
content: Curated from the archives of unions, the show highlights the lives of women workers who form the backbone of Bengaluru‚Äôs garment industry but remain invisible amid the focus on IT

title: Dharmasthala Mass Burial Case: Complainant Reveals His Connection With Activists
content: In a major twist in the alleged Dharmasthala murders case, the complainant, Chinnaiah, has revealed his connections with activists and also disclosed details of a trip to Delhi before making sensational allegations of rape and the murder of hundreds.

title: How Trump's Cabinet Turned A Government Meeting Into A Praise Parade
content: US President Donald Trump's latest Cabinet gathering - a marathon three-hour-plus session, looked more like a competition on who could praise Trump more than a government meeting.

title: Scientists Drilled Deep Under The Sea, Here's What They Learnt
content: Far beneath the waves, down in the depths of the Japan Trench - seven kilometres below sea level - lie hidden clues about some of the most powerful earthquakes and tsunamis on Earth.

title: "Economy To Sustain High Growth Momentum In Coming Quarters": Top Economist
content: Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran on Saturday said the high growth momentum exhibited in the first quarter of the current fiscal is expected to continue in the coming quarter as well, with a downward bias emanating from high US tariff

title: Woman Tries To Set Herself On fire After Police 'Failed' To Catch Her Rapist
content: A woman tried to immolate herself by pouring petrol on her body in the tehsil premises of Modinagar in Ghaziabad district, accusing the police of not taking proper action against the man who allegedly raped her, officials said on Saturday.

title: Thousands Protest Israeli Siege Of Gaza Near Venice Film Festival
content: Thousands of people protested against Israel's siege of Gaza on the sidelines of the Venice Film Festival, seeking to move the spotlight from movie drama to real-world trauma.

title: "Tejashwi Yadav Will Form Next Bihar Government": Akhilesh Yadav
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday said the Election Commission, which has ordered special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, has itself been subjected to "SIR" by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra'.

title: India Inc In "Cosy Comfort Zone", Not Venturing Out Globally: Piyush Goyal
content: Indian businesses are in a "cosy comfort zone" created by the presence of a 1.4 billion-person domestic market, and need to find opportunities globally, Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said on Saturday.

title: Ready To Seek BJP Support If It Allows Me To Do So: Opposition Veep Candidate
content: Opposition vice-president nominee B Sudershan Reddy sought support for his candidature from all members of the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha on merit, asserting that he was ready to meet the BJP top brass if it allows so.

title: Not "Dead Economy", It's "Long Live Economy": Shivraj Singh Chouhan On GDP Data
content: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan hailed the latest GDP figures, declaring that India has proven itself to be a "Long Live Economy" in the face of global headwinds.

title: Assam Police Constable 'Sexually Assaulted' Minor In Meghalaya, Arrested
content: An Assam Police constable was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl at a village in Meghalaya's Ri-Bhoi district, officials said on Saturday.

title: "Government Working Overtime To Cushion Export Sector From US Tariff": Top Economist
content: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) Anantha Nageswaran on Saturday said that the Centre, along with various stakeholders, was actively working overtime to cushion the export sector from the tariffs imposed by the United States.

title: Bathing, Cooking, Dancing: Maratha Protesters Turn Mumbai's Heritage Zone Into Campsite
content: Crowds appeared to be increasing on the second day of quota activist Manoj Jarange's hunger strike on Saturday, with thousands of Maratha protesters virtually turning the area surrounding the Azad Maidan in south Mumbai into their camp.

title: BJP MLA, 2 Others Injured In Accident On Udaipur Highway
content: BJP MLA from Rajasthan's Rajsamand Deepti Kiran Maheshwari, her personal assistant and driver were injured in an accident on the Udaipur-Rajsamand Highway here in the district on Saturday, police said.

title: India Set To Become World's 3rd Largest Economy: RBI Governor
content: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Sanjay Malhotra on Saturday said India will become the world's third-largest economy soon, and credited the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana for boosting the country's growth.

title: Karnataka High Court Seeks Centre's Reply On Plea Against Online Gaming Act
content: The Karnataka High Court sought the Union government's response to a petition challenging the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Act, 2025, which petitioners argue threatens to wipe out the livelihood of thousands of people overnight.

title: Video: Petrol Pump Employee Refuses Fuel To Helmetless Bikers, Shot At
content: A petrol pump employee, who was following the district administration's order of refusing fuel to two-wheeler riders not wearing helmets, has been shot at by two men in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind.

title: Maratha Quota Protesters Claim Poor Facilities At Mumbai Protest Site
content: Protesters gathered for the Manoj Jarange-led Maratha quota agitation at Mumbai's Azad Maidan complained about a lack of basic amenities, and non-availability of water and food at the venue.

title: Swimming Family Tradition: Mumbai Man Crosses English Channel In 22 Hours
content: Braving strong sea currents and cold water temperatures, Mumbai's Avinash Thadani completed a solo swim across the English Channel in 22 hours.

title: Ready to seek support from BJP top brass if they allow me: INDIA bloc V-P candidate
content: Justice (retd) B. Sudershan Reddy said he had sent letters to all members of the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha to consider his candidature on merit

title: Election Commission gets close to 2 lakh requests to remove¬†names from Bihar voters‚Äô list
content: The poll body got 29,872 requests for inclusion in the voters‚Äô list and 33,771 complaints settled. ECI deadline to file objections to the draft electoral roll ends on August 31

title: GST demands by Opposition-ruled States are ‚Äòperfectly legitimate‚Äô, says Jairam Ramesh
content: The Congress party hoped the GST Council meeting next week would ‚Äònot merely be a headline-grabbing exercise‚Äô, but would ‚Äòadvance the cause of cooperative federalism‚Äô

title: Honey on high
content: In Kashmir‚Äôs Pulwama, scientists from CSIR‚Äôs Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine take Peerzada Ashiq through the production process of India‚Äôs first bio-authenticated honey. Selling for between ‚Çπ5,000 and ‚Çπ6,000 per kilogram¬†in the global market, India has the potential to join countries like France, Spain, Italy, Bulgaria to compete in the high-end mono-floral honey sector¬†

title: Dharmasthala case: SIT probing responsibly and there is no need to hand over case to NIA, says Home Minister
content: SIT is doing its work with great responsibility as crores of devotees have expressed their concern and awaiting the truth: Parameshwara

title: Telangana Assembly to debate PC Ghose Commission‚Äôs report on Kaleshwaram on Sunday
content: Speaker Gaddam Prasad Kumar chairs the Business Advisory Committee (BAC) meeting in the Assembly on Saturday

title: BRS walks out of BAC meet protesting govt. plan to ‚Äúrun session for only two days‚Äù
content: Harish Rao says government appears to be interested in taking up issues serving its political interests, not people

title: Analysis: What awaits PM Modi at SCO Summit?
content: Modi‚Äôs meetings with Xi, Putin and ‚Äòanti-West‚Äô SCO leaders, and the attendance of Pakistan PM Sharif, Turkey‚Äôs Erdogan and Nepal‚Äôs K.P. Oli will be watched closely during the Tianjin visit; the SCO could issue a strong statement on Israel‚Äôs war in Gaza, which India may have to sign

title: Chargesheet filed against two for falsely implicating beauty parlour owner in drug case
content: Parlour owner spent 72 days in jail on charge of possession on LSD stamps, which were later found to be fake. Chargesheet filed against her daughter-in-law‚Äôs sister and her friend

title: Arvind Bellad takes exception to Vidhana Soudha‚Äôs banquet hall¬†being used for private function
content: He condemned the government for allowing a felicitation programme marking 50 years of professional service of former Advocate General Prof. Ravivarmakumar to be held at the hall

title: Nagaland medical students stage protest against govt decision to regularise 280 health workers
content: They argued that the government‚Äôs decision to bypass written exams for Class-I posts sets a dangerous precedent. Under the Nagaland Health Service Rules, recruitment for such posts requires 100% selection through NPSC.

title: Krishi Mela should help farmers tackle emerging challenges in farm sector: Santosh Lad
content: The farm fair, to be conducted from Sept. 13 to 16, is an important platform to provide farmers with information on new farm technologies, cropping methods and value addition to farm produce, he stresses

title: Government to replace the Ordinance on 42% reservations for BCs with a Bill in the Assembly on Sunday
content: The Panchayat Raj Act passed in 2018 during the previous BRS regime was the biggest hurdle as it capped total reservations for SCs, STs and BCs in local bodies at 50%, Minister Ponnam Prabhakar explained

title: Stepfather gets 55 years rigorous imprisonment for abusing minor girl
content: The accused has been fined ‚Çπ40,000. Failure to remit the fine will entail an additional two years and four months of imprisonment

title: Shivaji was not anti-Muslim, asserts Minister Lad
content: Shivaji Maharaj fought for the protection of all castes and religions, and he should not be confined only to the Maratha community, he states

title: 1,910 students graduate from NIT-C
content: Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar says NIT-C was the first such institute in the country to get designated by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs as a ‚Äòcentre of excellence in urban planning and designing‚Äô

title: Modi reassures Ukraine of India's support during call with Zelenskyy
content: During call with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, PM Modi discusses bilateral partnership progress and reaffirms support for peace in Ukraine

title: Karnataka HC directs Centre  to file response on interim plea on online gaming bill
content: The court has adjourned to September 8 the hearing on a petition challenging the Constitutional validity of the newly-enacted Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming (PROG) Act, 2025

title: Traffic grinds to a halt on NH stretch between Mudikkode and Peechi
content: Congestion lasts for a few hours, with hundreds of vehicles stranded. Both the service road and the main carriageway remained clogged. The collapse of the Mudikkode service road cited as primary reason for the gridlock

title: e-Health services gain momentum in Kottayam
content: e-Health facility to be implemented in nine more places this year in Kottayam. The facility is available in 45 centres out of 88 hospitals in the district currently

title: Minister releases digital magazine of students‚Äô works
content: Mazha Mannilezhuthiyathu includes students‚Äô writings, paintings and cartoons that featured at the Kerala State School Arts Festival this year

title: Shed fear of attrition and invest boldly in Andhra Pradesh, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu exhorts industrialists
content: Six MoUs worth ‚Çπ2,000 crore signed in the presence of Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, and they have a potential to generate 18,000 jobs

title: Victims of human-wildlife conflict, their kin should be made aware of legal rights, says SC judge
content: Judges speaking at a regional meet on human-wildlife conflicts call for a holistic, ecocentric approach to the issue

title: CPI(M) urges Andhra Pradesh govt. to release ‚Çπ10,000 crore for permanent Budameru flood prevention
content: Party says government has failed to implement lasting solutions since last year‚Äôs floods, leaving Vijayawada residents at risk

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar seeks pension from Rajasthan Assembly as former MLA
content: The pension from the State Assembly payable to Dhankhar will be in addition to the pension he will draw as the former Vice-President and an ex-MP

title: Projects worth ‚Çπ180 crore to be launched at Thiruvananthapuram MCH
content: Development projects worth ‚Çπ717.29 crore are ongoing at Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital. First phase projects have been completed and those in the second phase are at various stages of construction

title: News: Red Sox, Mets promote pitching prospects
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the franchise will activate Jackson Chourio from the 10-day IL in advance of this afternoon's contest . he's expected to resume his role as the every-day centerfielder .

title: Who has a shot at the championship? Projecting conference and Finals winners
content: this season, the Oklahoma City Thunder will look to become the first back-to-back champions since 2018 . but there will be plenty of challengers . the new york Knicks have plenty of postseason experience to push even fury .

title: What we're hearing before transfer deadline day: Liverpool to return for Isak?
content: the transfer window is only open across Europe until Monday . sportsmail's reporters are hearing about possible deals if Alexander Isak returns to the first-team . the premier league champions have played the long game with the striker . click here for more transfer news .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands as final month approaches
content: alden Gonzalez and Jesse Rogers weigh in on who they like most to come out on top of the American League wild-card race . teams are mostly split into three categories: those preparing for the playoffs, those trying to make a run at contention and those whose focus has turned to next season . there's still a fair amount to play for within those groups .

title: College football hot seats: Brace yourselves for potential blue-blood turnover
content: the college football job market took an expected turn last year . last offseason, there was a dip in head coaching changes at FBS football . the year before, a record 32 jobs turned over, per NCAA statistics .

title: Where will your team's next ballpark be? What Royals can teach us about the future of MLB stadiums
content: The K is located in the Truman Sports Complex, next to Arrowhead Stadium . your feelings about that location might depend on how you view the relationship between baseball and the cities in which it is played . in 2021, so long ago that Bobby Witt Jr. had not yet debuted in the majors, Royals owner John Sherman announced a search for a new venue .

title: PLL semifinals preview: Stats, matchups, how to watch
content: the 2025 premier lacrosse league playoffs continue this weekend on ESPN . the four teams travel to Subaru Park outside of Philadelphia for the semifinals . sports analyst Quint Kessenich revealed his keys to both matches . he will move ahead of casey Powel with four points .

title: The game is on the line: Which WNBA player gets the last shot?
content: nneka Ogwumike's clutch bucket at the buzzer gives the Storm an 84-82 win over the Mystics . sports experts contend there's no such thing as a consistent clutch player in any sport . who are the biggest clutch shooters in the WNBA, when a game is on the line .

title: Piastri takes pole ahead of Norris at Dutch GP
content: McLaren's Oscar Piastri starts on pole ahead of teammate Lando Norris at the 2025 Dutch Grand Prix . the f1 driver beats his teammate and title rival to the fastest time in qualifying by 0.012 seconds . norris had looked like the favorite for pole throughout free practice .
